definition: to drown/to indulge/addicted to/to spoil (a child)

sentences.english: He often indulges himself in drinking.
High school students indulged in the new freedom on such a scale as to shock their parents.
sentences.chinese: 中學生耽溺於這種新自由到了使他們父母震驚的地步。

sentences.english: No one forced him to indulge the false glamour of the weed .
sentences.chinese: 沒人強迫他耽溺在菸草虛假的魅力中。

sentences.english: Some of the young were addicted to drugs drugs the emptiness of their lives.
sentences.chinese: 一些年輕者耽溺於藥物下藥他們的生命的空虛。

sentences.english: A flexible body is usually more caught up in Bhoga.
sentences.chinese: 柔軟的身體更容易耽溺在練習上。

sentences.english: He abandoned himself to gambling and drinking.
On the other hand, I am seriously addicted to sex.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，我嚴重地耽溺於性別。

sentences.english: Yet in these thoughts my self almost despising.
sentences.chinese: 然而，耽溺於這些我亦鄙夷的思緒。

sentences.english: My name is Emma and I'm a recovering chocolate addict.
sentences.chinese: 我叫高艾嗎，也我是巧克力耽溺者再生。

sentences.english: Day-dreaming is when you indulge in it, repeating the same thing, over and over.
sentences.chinese: 白日夢是當你耽溺在其中，一而再再而三地重複。

definition: deeply immersed/fig. wallowing in/deeply engrossed in
to indulge in/to wallow/absorbed in/deeply engrossed/addicted
to indulge in something to one's heart's content/wanton or willful
to cling to/to be reluctant to give up (sth)/to have a fondness for (an indulgence etc)
to float about/(of a feeling) to show on the face/(of speech, friendship etc) shallow/vague
